docs.snippet: A dinner at the White House helped David J. Pecker, whose company owns The National Enquirer, showcase his connections as he sought to expand into Saudi Arabia.

headline.print_headline: Tabloid Mogul Visited Trump To Woo Saudis
headline.main: Wooing Saudi Business, Tabloid Mogul Had a Powerful Friend: Trump

docs.snippet: President Trump blamed Democrats and the Mexican government for an increasingly “dangerous” flow of illegal immigrants.

headline.print_headline: As Refugee Caravan Heads North, Trump Rails Against DACA and Nafta
headline.main: Venting on Immigration, Trump Vows ‘No More DACA Deal’ and Threatens Nafta

docs.snippet: Democrats begged President Trump to seek the extradition of 13 Russians accused of interfering in the 2016 election after Russia’s leader blamed “Jews.”

headline.print_headline: Putin Mention of Jews Spurs Calls for U.S. to Extradite Russians
headline.main: After Putin Cites Jews, Democrats Implore Trump to Extradite Russians

docs.snippet: In a meandering speech, the president seemed to undercut his administration’s initiatives, including on infrastructure and a trade pact with South Korea.

headline.print_headline: Praise for Trade Deal, Then Trump Suggests That He Might Delay It
headline.main: Trump Heralds South Korea Trade Deal, Then Says He Might Delay It

docs.snippet: A governor’s election in California is a changing of the guard at a moment when the state is involved in a high-stakes battle with President Trump.

headline.print_headline: Who Will Lead California as Trump Leads a Battle Against It?
headline.main: As Trump Leads a ‘War’ on California, Who Will Lead California?

docs.snippet: Experts say the conversations most likely do not constitute witness tampering, but they show how the president has ignored advice to avoid the appearance of interfering.

headline.print_headline: Potential Complications in Asking Witnesses if They Had Been ‘Nice’
headline.main: Trump Asked Key Witnesses About Matters They Discussed With Special Counsel

docs.snippet: A poor Afghan farming family named their son Donald Trump, hoping the other Trump’s good fortune would rub off on him. So far, it hasn’t.

headline.print_headline: Poor Afghan Family Names Son After Trump. It Hasn’t Paid Off.
headline.main: The Story of an Afghan Baby Named Donald Trump

docs.snippet: President Trump, expressing his disdain for Nafta and Obama-era immigration policies, said he will send the military to guard the United States border with Mexico.

headline.main: Trump: Military Will Guard Mexico Border

docs.snippet: What demands will the American president have for his meeting with Kim Jong-un?

headline.print_headline: Kim Jong-un Prepares to Meet Donald Trump
headline.main: Kim Jong-un Prepares to Meet Donald Trump

docs.snippet: The fund-raiser, Elliott Broidy, suggested to prospective clients of his security firm, including some with unsavory records, that he could arrange meetings with the president or his associates.

headline.print_headline: Marketing Ties to Trump, Top Donor Made Millions
headline.main: Fund-Raiser Held Out Access to Trump as a Prize for Prospective Clients
